author: Staff Reporter
text:
Members of the Joint Action Committee of Teachers’ Organisations staging a demonstration at Sivananda Colony in the city on Saturday. —Photo: S. Siva Saravanan.

More than 1,000 members of the Joint Action Committee of Tamil Nadu Teachers’ Organisation (JACTTO) staged a demonstration near the Sivanandha Colony Bus Stop on Saturday demanding salary and other benefits on par with other government employees, as per the recommendations of the Sixth Pay Commission. It was among the 15 demands they raised at the protest. Their other demands included making Tamil first language in government schools in the State.

The demonstrators including around 700 women were arrested by police and released later that day.
title: School teachers stage protest
